author: Staff Reporter
text:
The consecration of the 800-year-old Adikesavaperumal Temple at Thandalam village near Arakonam was held on Sunday.

Amidst the chanting of Vedic hymns, the chief priest poured water from sanctified kalasams atop the sanctum sanctorum to mark the ‘kumbabhishekam.’

According to a release, Radha Parthasarathy, managing trustee, E.K. Srinivasan, trustee, and a large of number of people from the village, Chennai and Bengaluru, were present.

Cultural programmes

The ‘kumbabhishekam’ was preceded by three days of ‘homams’ and Vedic chanting besides music, ‘therukoothu’ and cultural programmes.
title: Temple consecrated
